name: inclemency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality in weather of being unpleasant, especially with cold wind and rain: inclemency of the weather The house offered a little protection from the inclemency of the weather. Related word
clemency (WEATHER) formal
More examplesFewer examplesOwing to the inclemency of the weather the audience was very small.Men were forced to stand for hours and days at a time, exposed to the inclemencies of the weather as well as to the jeers and taunts of their fellows.We can create beautiful gardens, despite the inclemency of our seasons.They return famished with hunger, exposed to the inclemencies of the sky.Given the inclemency of our climate, most people would consider nut farming a lost cause.
